00001 // CLASSIFICATION: UNCLASSIFIED
00002 
00003 /****************************************************************************/
00004 /* RSC IDENTIFIER:  Ellipsoid Library Implementation
00005  *
00006  * ABSTRACT
00007  *
00008  *    The purpose of ELLIPSOID is to provide access to ellipsoid parameters
00009  *    for a collection of common ellipsoids.  A particular ellipsoid can be
00010  *    accessed by using its standard 2-letter code to find its index in the
00011  *    ellipsoid table.  The index can then be used to retrieve the ellipsoid
00012  *    name and parameters.
00013  *
00014  *    By sequentially retrieving all of the ellipsoid codes and/or names, a
00015  *    menu of the available ellipsoids can be constructed.  The index values
00016  *    resulting from selections from this menu can then be used to access the
00017  *    parameters of the selected ellipsoid.
00018  *
00019  *    This component depends on a data file named "ellips.dat", which contains
00020  *    the ellipsoid parameter values.  A copy of this file must be located in
00021  *    the directory specified by the environment variable "MSPCCS_DATA", if
00022  *    defined, or else in the current directory, whenever a program containing
00023  *    this component is executed.
00024  *
00025  *    Additional ellipsoids can be added to this file, either manually or using
00026  *    the Create_Ellipsoid function.  However, if a large number of ellipsoids
00027  *    are added, the ellipsoid table array size in this component will have to
00028  *    be increased.
00029  *
00030  * ERROR HANDLING
00031  *
00032  *    This component checks parameters for valid values.  If an invalid value
00033  *    is found, the error code is combined with the current error code using
00034  *    the bitwise or.  This combining allows multiple error codes to be
00035  *    returned. The possible error codes are:
00036  *
00037  *  ELLIPSE_NO_ERROR             : No errors occured in function
00038  *  ELLIPSE_FILE_OPEN_ERROR      : Ellipsoid file opening error
00039  *  ELLIPSE_INITIALIZE_ERROR     : Ellipsoid table can not initialize
00040  *  ELLIPSE_TABLE_OVERFLOW_ERROR : Ellipsoid table overflow
00041  *  ELLIPSE_NOT_INITIALIZED_ERROR: Ellipsoid table not initialized properly
00042  *  ELLIPSE_INVALID_INDEX_ERROR  : Index is an invalid value
00043  *  ELLIPSE_INVALID_CODE_ERROR   : Code was not found in table
00044  *  ELLIPSE_A_ERROR              : Semi-major axis less than or equal to zero
00045  *  ELLIPSE_INV_F_ERROR          : Inverse flattening outside of valid range
00046  *                                  (250 to 350)
00047  *  ELLIPSE_NOT_USERDEF_ERROR    : Ellipsoid is not user defined - cannot be
00048  *                                  deleted
00049  *
00050  * REUSE NOTES
00051  *
00052  *    Ellipsoid is intended for reuse by any application that requires Earth
00053  *    approximating ellipsoids.
00054  *
00055  * REFERENCES
00056  *
00057  *    Further information on Ellipsoid can be found in the Reuse Manual.
00058  *
00059  *    Ellipsoid originated from :  U.S. Army Topographic Engineering Center (USATEC)
00060  *                                 Geospatial Information Division (GID)
00061  *                                 7701 Telegraph Road
00062  *                                 Alexandria, VA  22310-3864
00063  *
00064  * LICENSES
00065  *
00066  *    None apply to this component.
00067  *
00068  * RESTRICTIONS
00069  *
00070  *    Ellipsoid has no restrictions.
00071  *
00072  * ENVIRONMENT
00073  *
00074  *    Ellipsoid was tested and certified in the following environments
00075  *
00076  *    1. Solaris 2.5
00077  *    2. Windows 95
00078  *
00079  * MODIFICATIONS
00080  *
00081  *    Date              Description
00082  *    ----              -----------
00083  *    11-19-95          Original Code
00084  *    17-Jan-97         Moved local constants out of public interface
00085  *                      Improved efficiency in algorithms (GEOTRANS)
00086  *    24-May-99         Added user-defined ellipsoids (GEOTRANS for JMTK)
00087  *    06-27-06          Moved data file to data directory
00088  *    03-09-07          Original C++ Code
00089  *
00090  */
00091 
00092

00096  */

00114  *    DatumLibraryImplementation.h    - used to determine

00132 const int MAX_ELLIPSOIDS = 32;        /* Maximum number of ellipsoids in table */
00133 const int ELLIPSOID_CODE_LENGTH = 3;  /* Length of ellipsoid code (including null) */
00134 const int ELLIPSOID_NAME_LENGTH = 30; /* Max length of ellipsoid name */
00135 const int ELLIPSOID_BUF = 90;
00136 const int FILENAME_LENGTH = 128;
00137 const char *WGS84_Ellipsoid_Code = "WE";
00138 const char *WGS72_Ellipsoid_Code = "WD";

00166 EllipsoidLibraryImplementation* EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::getInstance()
00167 {

00169     instance = new EllipsoidLibraryImplementation;
00170 
00171   instanceCount++;
00172 
00173   return instance;

00180  * The function removeInstance removes this EllipsoidLibraryImplementation instance from the

00182  */

00185     deleteInstance();

00204 EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::EllipsoidLibraryImplementation():
00205   _datumLibraryImplementation( 0 )
00206 {
00207 /*
00208  * The constructor creates an empty list to store the ellipsoid data from ellips.dat
00209  * which is used to build the ellipsoid table.  
00210  */
00211 
00212   ellipsoidList.reserve( MAX_ELLIPSOIDS );
00213 
00214   loadEllipsoids();
00215 }

00218 EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::EllipsoidLibraryImplementation( const EllipsoidLibraryImplementation &el )
00219 {
00220   int size = el.ellipsoidList.size();
00221   for( int i = 0; i < size; i++ )
00222     ellipsoidList.push_back( new Ellipsoid( *( el.ellipsoidList[i] ) ) );
00223 
00224   _datumLibraryImplementation = el._datumLibraryImplementation;
00225 }
00226 
00227 
00228 EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::~EllipsoidLibraryImplementation()
00229 {
00230   std::vector<Ellipsoid*>::iterator iter = ellipsoidList.begin();
00231   while( iter != ellipsoidList.end() )
00232         {
00233                 delete( *iter );
00234     iter++;
00235         }
00236   ellipsoidList.clear();
00237 
00238   _datumLibraryImplementation = 0;
00239 }

00242 EllipsoidLibraryImplementation& EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::operator=( const EllipsoidLibraryImplementation &el )
00243 {
00244   if ( &el == this )
00245           return *this;
00246 
00247   int size = el.ellipsoidList.size();
00248   for( int i = 0; i < size; i++ )
00249     ellipsoidList[i] = new Ellipsoid( *( el.ellipsoidList[i] ) );
00250 
00251   _datumLibraryImplementation = el._datumLibraryImplementation;
00252 
00253   return *this;
00254 }

00256 
00257 void EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::defineEllipsoid( const char* code, const char* name, double semiMajorAxis, double flattening )
00258 { 
00259 /*
00260  * The function defineEllipsoid creates a new ellipsoid with the specified
00261  * Code, name, and axes.  If the ellipsoid table has not been initialized,
00262  * the specified code is already in use, or a new version of the ellips.dat
00263  * file cannot be created, an exception is thrown.
00264  * Note that the indexes of all ellipsoids in the ellipsoid
00265  * table may be changed by this function.
00266  *
00267  *   code           : 2-letter ellipsoid code.                      (input)
00268  *   name           : Name of the new ellipsoid                     (input)
00269  *   semiMajorAxis  : Semi-major axis, in meters, of new ellipsoid  (input)
00270  *   flattening     : Flattening of new ellipsoid.                  (input)
00271  *
00272  */
00273 
00274   long code_length = 0;
00275   char *PathName = NULL;
00276   char FileName[FILENAME_LENGTH];
00277   char ellipsoid_code[ELLIPSOID_CODE_LENGTH];
00278   FILE *fp = NULL;                    /* File pointer to file ellips.dat     */
00279   long index = 0;
00280   long numEllipsoids = ellipsoidList.size();
00281   double inv_f = 1 / flattening;
00282 
00283   if( !( numEllipsoids < MAX_ELLIPSOIDS ) )
00284     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::ellipsoidOverflow );
00285   else
00286   {
00287     try
00288     {
00289       ellipsoidIndex( code, &index );
00290       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidEllipsoidCode );
00291     }
00292     catch(CoordinateConversionException e)
00293     {
00294     }
00295 
00296     code_length = strlen( code );
00297     if( /*( !ellipsoidIndex( code, &index ) ) || */( code_length > ( ELLIPSOID_CODE_LENGTH - 1 ) ) )
00298       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidEllipsoidCode );
00299     if( semiMajorAxis <= 0.0 )
00300       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::semiMajorAxis );
00301     if( (inv_f < 250 ) || ( inv_f > 350 ) )
00302     { /* Inverse flattening must be between 250 and 350 */
00303       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::ellipsoidFlattening );
00304     }
00305 
00306     strcpy( ellipsoid_code, code );
00307     /* Convert code to upper case */
00308     for( int i = 0; i < code_length; i++ )
00309       ellipsoid_code[i] = ( char )toupper( ellipsoid_code[i] );
00310 
00311     double semiMinorAxis = semiMajorAxis * ( 1 - flattening );
00312     double eccentricitySquared = 2.0 * flattening - flattening * flattening;
00313     ellipsoidList.push_back( new Ellipsoid( index, ellipsoid_code, ( char* )name, semiMajorAxis, semiMinorAxis, flattening, eccentricitySquared, true ) );
00314 
00315     numEllipsoids++;
00316 
00317     Thread_Mutex ellipsoid_mutex;
00318     long mutex_error = Threads_Create_Mutex(&ellipsoid_mutex);
00319     if( !mutex_error )
00320       mutex_error = Threads_Lock_Mutex(ellipsoid_mutex);
00321 
00322     /*output updated ellipsoid table*/
00323     PathName = getenv( "MSPCCS_DATA" );
00324     if( PathName != NULL )
00325     {
00326       strcpy( FileName, PathName );
00327       strcat( FileName, "/" );
00328     }
00329     else
00330     {
00331       strcpy( FileName, "../../data/" );
00332     }
00333     strcat( FileName, "ellips.dat" );
00334 
00335     if( ( fp = fopen( FileName, "w" ) ) == NULL )
00336     { /* fatal error */
00337       if( !mutex_error )
00338         mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex(ellipsoid_mutex);
00339       if( !mutex_error )
00340         Threads_Destroy_Mutex(ellipsoid_mutex);
00341 
00342       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::ellipsoidFileOpenError );
00343     }
00344 
00345     /* write file */
00346     index = 0;
00347     while( index < numEllipsoids )
00348     {
00349       if( ellipsoidList[index]->userDefined() )
00350         fprintf( fp, "*");
00351 
00352       fprintf( fp, "%-29s  %-2s %11.9f %12.9f %13.13f \n",
00353                ellipsoidList[index]->name(),
00354                ellipsoidList[index]->code(),
00355                ellipsoidList[index]->semiMajorAxis(),
00356                ellipsoidList[index]->semiMinorAxis(),
00357                1 / ellipsoidList[index]->flattening() );
00358       index++;
00359     }
00360 
00361     fclose( fp );
00362 
00363     if( !mutex_error )
00364       mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex(ellipsoid_mutex);
00365     if( !mutex_error )
00366       Threads_Destroy_Mutex(ellipsoid_mutex);
00367   }
00368 } 
00369 
00370 
00371 void EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::removeEllipsoid( const char* code )
00372 {
00373 /*
00374  * The function removeEllipsoid deletes a user defined ellipsoid with
00375  * the specified Code.  If the ellipsoid table has not been created,
00376  * the specified code is in use by a user defined datum, or a new version
00377  * of the ellips.dat file cannot be created, an exception is thrown.
00378  * Note that the indexes of all
00379  * ellipsoids in the ellipsoid table may be changed by this function.
00380  *
00381  *   code     : 2-letter ellipsoid code.                      (input)
00382  *
00383  */
00384 
00385   long index = 0;
00386   char *PathName = NULL;
00387   char FileName[FILENAME_LENGTH];
00388   FILE *fp = NULL;                    /* File pointer to file ellips.dat     */
00389 
00390   ellipsoidIndex( code, &index );
00391   if( ellipsoidList[index]->userDefined() )
00392   {
00393     if( _datumLibraryImplementation )
00394     {
00395       if( _datumLibraryImplementation->datumUsesEllipsoid( code ) )
00396         throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::ellipseInUse );
00397     }
00398   }
00399   else
00400     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::notUserDefined );
00401 
00402 //  if( /*ellipsoidIndex( code, &index ) ||*/ !ellipsoidList[index]->userDefined() )
00403 //    throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::notUserDefined );
00404 //  else
00405   {
00406     int numEllipsoids = ellipsoidList.size();
00407 
00408     int i = 0;
00409     for( i = index; i < numEllipsoids; i++ )
00410       ellipsoidList[i] = ellipsoidList[i+1];
00411 
00412     if( numEllipsoids != MAX_ELLIPSOIDS )
00413       ellipsoidList[i] = ellipsoidList[i+1];
00414     else
00415       ellipsoidList.erase( ellipsoidList.end() - 1 );
00416 
00417     numEllipsoids--;
00418     ellipsoidList.resize( numEllipsoids );
00419 
00420     Thread_Mutex ellipsoid_mutex;
00421     long mutex_error = Threads_Create_Mutex(&ellipsoid_mutex);
00422     if( !mutex_error )
00423       mutex_error = Threads_Lock_Mutex(ellipsoid_mutex);
00424 
00425     /*output updated ellipsoid table*/
00426     PathName = getenv( "MSPCCS_DATA" );
00427     if( PathName != NULL )
00428     {
00429       strcpy( FileName, PathName );
00430       strcat( FileName, "/" );
00431     }
00432     else
00433     {
00434       strcpy( FileName, "../../data/" );
00435     }
00436     strcat( FileName, "ellips.dat" );
00437     if( ( fp = fopen( FileName, "w" ) ) == NULL )
00438     { /* fatal error */
00439       if( !mutex_error )
00440         mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex(ellipsoid_mutex);
00441       if( !mutex_error )
00442         Threads_Destroy_Mutex(ellipsoid_mutex);
00443 
00444       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::ellipsoidFileOpenError );
00445     }
00446     /* write file */
00447     index = 0;
00448     while( index < numEllipsoids )
00449     {
00450       if( ellipsoidList[index]->userDefined() )
00451         fprintf( fp, "*" );
00452 
00453       fprintf(fp, "%-29s  %-2s %11.3f %12.4f %13.9f \n",
00454                  ellipsoidList[index]->name(),
00455                  ellipsoidList[index]->code(),
00456                  ellipsoidList[index]->semiMajorAxis(),
00457                  ellipsoidList[index]->semiMinorAxis(),
00458                  1 / ellipsoidList[index]->flattening() );
00459       index++;
00460     }
00461 
00462     fclose( fp );
00463 
00464     if( !mutex_error )
00465       mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex(ellipsoid_mutex);
00466     if( !mutex_error )
00467       Threads_Destroy_Mutex(ellipsoid_mutex);
00468   }
00469 }

00472 void EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::ellipsoidCount( long *count )
00473 { 
00474 /*
00475  * The function ellipsoidCount returns the number of ellipsoids in the
00476  * ellipsoid table.  If the ellipsoid table has not been initialized,
00477  * an exception is thrown.
00478  *
00479  *   count    : The number of ellipsoids in the ellipsoid table. (output)
00480  *
00481  */
00482 
00483   *count = ellipsoidList.size();
00484 } 
00485 
00486 
00487 void EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::ellipsoidIndex( const char *code, long* index )
00488 { 
00489 /*
00490  *  The function ellipsoidIndex returns the index of the ellipsoid in
00491  *  the ellipsoid table with the specified code.  If ellipsoid code is not found,
00492  *  an exception is thrown.
00493  *
00494  *    code     : 2-letter ellipsoid code.                      (input)
00495  *    index    : Index of the ellipsoid in the ellipsoid table with the
00496  *                  specified code                             (output)
00497  *
00498  */
00499 
00500   char temp_code[3];
00501   long i = 0;                   /* index for ellipsoid table */
00502   long j = 0;
00503 
00504   while( j < ELLIPSOID_CODE_LENGTH )
00505   {
00506     temp_code[j] = ( char )toupper(code[j]);
00507     j++;
00508   }
00509   temp_code[ELLIPSOID_CODE_LENGTH - 1] = 0;
00510 
00511   int numEllipsoids = ellipsoidList.size();
00512   while( ( i < numEllipsoids )
00513          && strcmp( temp_code, ellipsoidList[i]->code() ) )
00514   {
00515     i++;
00516   }
00517 
00518   if( i == numEllipsoids )
00519     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidEllipsoidCode );
00520   else
00521   {
00522     if ( strcmp( temp_code, ellipsoidList[i]->code() ) )
00523       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidEllipsoidCode );
00524     else
00525       *index = i;
00526   }
00527 } 
00528 
00529 
00530 void EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::ellipsoidCode( const long index, char *code )
00531 { 
00532 /*
00533  *  The Function ellipsoidCode returns the 2-letter code for the
00534  *  ellipsoid in the ellipsoid table with the specified index.  If index is
00535  *  invalid, an exception is thrown.
00536  *
00537  *    index    : Index of a given ellipsoid in the ellipsoid table (input)
00538  *    code     : 2-letter ellipsoid code.                          (output)
00539  *
00540  */
00541 
00542   strcpy( code, "" );
00543 
00544   if ( ( index < 0 ) || ( index >= ellipsoidList.size() ) )
00545     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
00546   else
00547     strcpy( code, ellipsoidList[index]->code() );
00548 }

00551 void EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::ellipsoidName( const long index, char *name )
00552 { 
00553 /*
00554  *  The function ellipsoidName returns the name of the ellipsoid in
00555  *  the ellipsoid table with the specified index.  If index is invalid,
00556  *  an exception is thrown.
00557  *
00558  *    index   : Index of a given ellipsoid.in the ellipsoid table with the
00559  *                 specified index                             (input)
00560  *    name    : Name of the ellipsoid referencd by index       (output)
00561  *
00562  */
00563 
00564   strcpy( name,"" );
00565 
00566   if( ( index < 0 ) || ( index >= ellipsoidList.size() ) )
00567     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
00568   else
00569     strcpy( name, ellipsoidList[index]->name() );
00570 } 
00571 
00572 
00573 void EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::ellipsoidParameters( const long index, double *a, double *f )
00574 { 
00575 /*
00576  *  The function ellipsoidParameters returns the semi-major axis and flattening
00577  *  for the ellipsoid with the specified index.  If index is invalid,
00578  *  exception is thrown.
00579  *
00580  *    index    : Index of a given ellipsoid in the ellipsoid table (input)
00581  *    a        : Semi-major axis, in meters, of ellipsoid          (output)
00582  *    f        : Flattening of ellipsoid.                          (output)
00583  *
00584  */
00585 
00586   *a = 0;
00587   *f = 0;
00588 
00589   if( ( index < 0 ) || ( index >= ellipsoidList.size() ) )
00590     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
00591   else
00592   {
00593     Ellipsoid* ellipsoid = ellipsoidList[index];
00594     *a = ellipsoid->semiMajorAxis();
00595     *f = ellipsoid->flattening();
00596   }
00597 }

00600 void EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::ellipsoidEccentricity2( const long index, double *eccentricitySquared )
00601 { 
00602 /*
00603  *  The function ellipsoidEccentricity2 returns the square of the
00604  *  eccentricity for the ellipsoid with the specified index.  If index is
00605  *  invalid, an exception is thrown.
00606  *
00607  *    index                : Index of a given ellipsoid in the ellipsoid table (input)
00608  *    eccentricitySquared  : Square of eccentricity of ellipsoid               (output)
00609  *
00610  */
00611 
00612   *eccentricitySquared = 0;
00613 
00614   if( ( index < 0 ) || ( index >= ellipsoidList.size() ) )
00615     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
00616   else
00617     *eccentricitySquared = ellipsoidList[index]->eccentricitySquared();
00618 }

00620 
00621 void EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::ellipsoidUserDefined( const long index, long *result )
00622 { 
00623 /*
00624  *  The function ellipsoidUserDefined returns 1 if the ellipsoid is user
00625  *  defined.  Otherwise, 0 is returned.  If index is invalid,
00626  *  an exception is thrown.
00627  *
00628  *    index    : Index of a given ellipsoid in the ellipsoid table (input)
00629  *    result   : Indicates whether specified ellipsoid is user defined (1)
00630  *               or not (0)                                        (output)
00631  *
00632  */
00633 
00634   *result = false;
00635 
00636   if( ( index < 0 ) || ( index >= ellipsoidList.size() ) )
00637     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::invalidIndex );
00638   else
00639     *result = ellipsoidList[index]->userDefined();
00640 } 
00641 
00642 
00643 void EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::setDatumLibraryImplementation( DatumLibraryImplementation* __datumLibraryImplementation )
00644 {
00645 /*
00646  *  The function setDatumLibraryImplementation sets the datum library information
00647  *  which is needed to ensure a user defined ellipsoid is not in use before being deleted.
00648  *
00649  *   __datumLibraryImplementation  : Datum library implementation      (input)
00650  *
00651  */
00652 
00653   _datumLibraryImplementation = __datumLibraryImplementation;
00654 }
00655 
00656 
00657 /************************************************************************/
00658 /*                              PRIVATE FUNCTIONS     
00659  *
00660  */
00661 
00662 void EllipsoidLibraryImplementation::loadEllipsoids()
00663 {
00664 /*
00665  * The function loadEllipsoids reads ellipsoid data from ellips.dat
00666  * and builds the ellipsoid table from it.  If an error occurs, an 
00667  * exception is thrown.
00668  */
00669 
00670   char* PathName = NULL;
00671   char* FileName = 0;
00672   FILE* fp = NULL;                    /* File pointer to file ellips.dat     */
00673   char buffer[ELLIPSOID_BUF];
00674   long index = 0;                     /* Array index                         */
00675 
00676   Thread_Mutex ellipsoid_mutex;
00677   long mutex_error = Threads_Create_Mutex(&ellipsoid_mutex);
00678   if( !mutex_error )
00679     mutex_error = Threads_Lock_Mutex(ellipsoid_mutex);
00680 
00681   /*  Check the environment for a user provided path, else current directory;   */
00682   /*  Build a File Name, including specified or default path:                   */
00683 
00684   PathName = getenv( "MSPCCS_DATA" );
00685   if (PathName != NULL)
00686   {
00687     FileName = new char[ strlen( PathName ) + 12 ];
00688     strcpy( FileName, PathName );
00689     strcat( FileName, "/" );
00690   }
00691   else
00692   {
00693     FileName = new char[ 19 ];
00694     strcpy( FileName, "../../data/" );
00695   }
00696   strcat( FileName, "ellips.dat" );
00697 
00698   /*  Open the File READONLY, or Return Error Condition:                        */
00699 
00700   if( ( fp = fopen( FileName, "r" ) ) == NULL )
00701   {
00702     delete [] FileName;
00703     FileName = 0;
00704 
00705     if( !mutex_error )
00706       mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex(ellipsoid_mutex);
00707     if( !mutex_error )
00708       Threads_Destroy_Mutex(ellipsoid_mutex);
00709 
00710     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::ellipsoidFileOpenError );
00711   }
00712 
00713   /* read file */
00714   while( !feof( fp ) )
00715   {
00716     if( index <= MAX_ELLIPSOIDS )
00717     {
00718 
00719       if( fgets( buffer, ELLIPSOID_BUF, fp ) )
00720       {
00721         char name[ELLIPSOID_NAME_LENGTH];
00722         char code[ELLIPSOID_CODE_LENGTH];
00723         double semiMajorAxis;
00724         double semiMinorAxis;
00725         double recpF;
00726 
00727         sscanf( buffer, "%30c %s %lf %lf %lf", name, code,  &semiMajorAxis, &semiMinorAxis, &recpF );
00728 
00729         bool userDefined = false;  /* Identifies a user defined ellipsoid */
00730         if( name[0] == '*' )
00731         {
00732           userDefined = true;
00733           for( int i = 0; i < ELLIPSOID_NAME_LENGTH; i++ )
00734             name[i] = name[i+1];
00735         }
00736 
00737         name[ELLIPSOID_NAME_LENGTH - 1] = '\0'; /* null terminate */
00738 
00739         double flattening = 1 / recpF;
00740         double eccentricitySquared = 2.0 * flattening - flattening * flattening;
00741 
00742         ellipsoidList.push_back( new Ellipsoid( index, code, name, semiMajorAxis, semiMinorAxis, flattening, eccentricitySquared, userDefined ) );
00743 
00744         index++;
00745       }
00746     }
00747     else
00748       throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::ellipsoidOverflow );
00749   }
00750   
00751   fclose( fp );
00752 
00753   if( !mutex_error )
00754     mutex_error = Threads_Unlock_Mutex(ellipsoid_mutex);
00755   if( !mutex_error )
00756     Threads_Destroy_Mutex(ellipsoid_mutex);
00757 
00758   delete [] FileName;
00759   FileName = 0;
00760 }
